Stay up-to-date with current trends and developments in science education and laboratory practices.
Perform other duties as assigned by the science department head or school administration.Requirements:3-4 years of experience working in a science laboratory setting, preferably in a school environment.
Matric/O Level or equivalent qualification in science-related subjects.
Strong understanding of laboratory procedures and safety protocols.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
Proficiency in basic computer applications.
Attention to detail and accuracy in recording data.
Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.
Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work schedules.We offer a competitive salary and benefits package commensurate with experience. If you meet the above qualifications and are passionate about science education, we encourage you to apply for this position. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications. As a content-driven service, we understand the importance of impactful and tailored documents in today's competitive job market.Our commitment to excellence, creativity, and satisfaction sets us apart in the industry. As a forward-thinking company, we are constantly exploring new avenues to enhance our offerings and contribute meaningfully to the success.We offer a great environment to learn new skills and progressive career growth awaits the selected candidate. Collaborate with other team members, including designers, marketers, and subject matter experts, to create comprehensive and impactful content that meets clients' needs and expectations
Stay up-to-date with the latest digital marketing trends, industry news, and best practices. 3 years of proven experience as a content writer
Work as part of a team and good soft skills
Think creatively and develop new ideas

Ability to work under tight deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously

Strong ability to design with accessibility in mindIf you are a talented and passionate creative content writer and want to be part of a dynamic team, Adequate Solutions welcomes your application. Join us in shaping the future of IT and marketing solutions!Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: Rs20,000.00 - Rs30,000.00 per monthExpected hours: 25 – 30 per weekApplication Question(s):This is a remote job, are you available to join this position?
How much do you expect your salary per month?
Can you provide a brief introduction about yourself, your professional background, and experience in content writing?
Suppose a situation where an individual is unable to make payment due to financial constraints or other issues, but he commitment you that he will pay you in a few months or whenever the work is fully started, then he will pay you. Additionally, they commit not only to providing a salary but also offering comprehensive support throughout the duration of the long-term project. Would you consider collaborating with this person, and if so, what factors would influence your decision?
How do you approach educating others about sexual health and behavior, that these topics are very sensitive and not allowed in our society and religion?
How have you handled situations where a company or client’s sexual behaviors or issues conflicted with your personal beliefs or values. What is the best way to handle this situation?
Alhamdulillah we're a Muslim state, but there's concern: Why does Pakistan (being an Islamic country) ranked the top irrelevant websites (such as sexual content) searching nation in the world, according to Google? I'm uncertain about the accuracy of this information, but if true, what could be the reasons behind it?
Before submitting your application/resume, kindly please share your portfolio or Google drive link with me and answer all the above questions (because this is your initial test and please don't write more than 4-6 lines)?Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:content writing: 3 years (Preferred)

Job Title: Business Data Analyst - Remote Job/ WFH
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in sales and marketing analytics, with experience in Python coding. As a Sales and Marketing Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting data to provide valuable insights that drive sales and marketing strategies
 Job Description

 Utilise Python coding skills to extract, clean, and analyse large datasets for sales and marketing purposes.
 Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and measure the effectiveness of sales and marketing campaigns.
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and finance, to identify data-driven opportunities for growth and improvement.
 Conduct an in-depth analysis of sales and marketing data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for optimisation.
 Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis to enhance sales and marketing strategies and drive revenue growth.
 Monitor and evaluate the performance of sales and marketing initiatives, and identify areas for improvement.
 Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in sales and marketing analytics.
 Ensure data accuracy and integrity by conducting regular data audits and quality checks.
 Present findings and insights to stakeholders and senior management in a clear and concise manner.
 Collaborate with IT teams to develop and implement data automation and optimisation solutions.

 Qualifications

 Fresh Grad with 1 to 2 years experience with Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
 Proven experience in sales and marketing analytics, with a strong focus on data analysis and interpretation.
 Proficiency in Python coding, with the ability to extract, clean, and analyse large datasets.
 Strong attention to detail and ability to identify patterns and trends in complex data sets.
 Familiarity with data visualisation tools, such as Tableau or Power BI, to create interactive dashboards and reports.
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
 Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
 Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
 Knowledge of sales and marketing principles and strategies is preferred.
 Experience with basic SQL, data warehousing, data scrapping using 3rd party or self-developed tools, and data mining techniques.

 Additional information
 Benefits

 Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
 Comprehensive training and mentorship programs to support your professional growth.

Job Overview:As a Database Scientist, you will be responsible for conducting advanced research and development in database systems, including data management, optimization, and scalability. You will work on innovative projects to advance the state of the art in database technologies and contribute to solving complex data management challenges.Responsibilities:Research and Development: Conduct research in database systems, including data storage, query processing, indexing, and distributed computing. Develop innovative algorithms and techniques to improve database performance, scalability, and reliability.
Database Architecture: Design and architect database systems, including relational, NoSQL, and NewSQL databases, to meet specific performance, scalability, and availability requirements. Evaluate and recommend database technologies and architectures for different use cases and workloads.
Data Modeling and Analysis: Develop data models and schemas to represent complex data structures and relationships. Analyze and optimize data models for efficient storage, retrieval, and processing of large-scale datasets.
Performance Optimization: Optimize database performance through query optimization, indexing strategies, caching mechanisms, and parallel processing techniques. Benchmark and profile database systems to identify performance bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Data Security and Privacy: Implement and enforce data security and privacy measures to protect sensitive data stored in databases. Develop and implement encryption, access control, and auditing mechanisms to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
Database Administration: Perform database administration tasks, including installation, configuration, tuning, and monitoring of database systems. Manage database backups, replication, and disaster recovery procedures to ensure data availability and integrity.
Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, data scientists, and business analysts, to develop database solutions that meet business requirements. Communicate technical concepts and findings to non-technical stakeholders effectively.Qualifications:Ph.D. or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field with a focus on database systems.
Strong background in database systems, including relational databases, NoSQL databases, and distributed database systems.
Proficiency in database programming languages such as SQL, PL/SQL, T-SQL, and experience with database management systems such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, etc.Job Type: Part-timeSalary: Rs100,000.00 per monthExpected hours: No more than 28 per weekAbility to Commute:Lahore (Required)Ability to Relocate:Lahore: Relocate before starting work (Required)

J-202402-133
 Pakistan (Islamabad)


 Description


 TEKenable are looking for dynamic and talented recent graduates to join our Graduate Trainee Program 2024 in Data Sciences. This program is designed to provide recent graduates with hands-on experience and training in data analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. As a Graduate Trainee, you will have the opportunity to work on diverse projects, learn from seasoned professionals, and contribute to the evolution of data-driven solutions.

 TEKenable combines 20 years of traditional software development with the very latest low-code cloud platforms to deliver end-to-end digital transformation. At TEKenable we bring the full range of Microsoft & Salesforce technologies and best-of-breed Low-Code platforms. We are an approved Salesforce partner as well as Gold Certified for Azure Cloud and Application Development and a Microsoft Solutions provider. We have extensive experience in legacy systems integration and offer licensing and Azure cloud as Managed Services.

 Key Responsibilities:

 Data Analysis and Visualisation: Acquire proficiency in analyzing large datasets, deriving insights, and presenting findings through visualization tools. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
 Machine Learning and Predictive Modelling: Develop foundational skills in machine learning algorithms and predictive modelling. Work on building and deploying machine learning models to solve real-world business challenges.
 Data Cleansing and Preprocessing: Assist in data cleansing, preprocessing, and transformation to ensure high-quality data for analysis and modeling. Collaborate with data engineers to optimize data pipelines.
 Collaboration and Learning: Actively participate in collaborative projects, knowledge-sharing sessions, and continuous learning opportunities. Attend workshops and training sessions to stay updated on the latest advancements in data sciences.
 Problem Solving: Apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to address complex data-related challenges. Contribute innovative ideas to enhance the effectiveness of data solutions.


 Qualifications:

 Recent university graduate with a bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
 Solid understanding of data analytics concepts and a keen interest in data sciences.
 Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R is advantageous.
 Working knowledge of Database systems; SQL and No SQL.
 Some knowledge about Azure Data Platforms eg Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse analytics, Azure Data Lake, and Microsoft Fabrics.
 Knowledge about notebooks, PySpark.
 Knowledge and interest in AI/ML is a plus
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.


 Benefits:

 Comprehensive training program in data sciences.
 Exposure to diverse data projects and industry sectors.
 Mentorship from experienced professionals in the field.
 Competitive salary and benefits package.
 Opportunities for career growth and specialisation in data sciences.


 TEKenable was named Technology Business of the Year, was included in the Deloitte Fast50 for 3 years running and won the Fast50 Impact award. We have global reach with operations in Ireland, the UK, Hungry, Spain & UAE and expertise across Financial Services, Healthcare, Agri-Food, and the Public Sector.

 At TEKenable we foster a culture of diversity and inclusion as we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of gender, disability, sexual orientation, generation, or belief.

 TEKenable is an equal opportunity employer and encourages candidates from all backgrounds to apply. We look forward to welcoming new talents to our team!

Organizational Context and Scope :
The Displacement Tracking Matrix (DTM) is a system to track and monitor displacement and population mobility, and is designed to regularly and systematically capture, process and disseminate information providing a better understanding of the movements and evolving needs of displaced populations, whether on-site or enroute. In recent years DTM has become increasingly recognized as the primary source of displacement and migration data and information sources at country, regional and global levels. As a result of its worldwide presence, flexibility, and interoperability, DTM is now being implemented in Pakistan.
One of the core functions of DTM is data collection targeting various types of mobile populations and communities living with them through various methods such as face to face and/or telephonic interviews. Several enumerators and field coordination assistants will be assigned to conduct data collection and coordinate the effort at the field level. In order to have smooth and well-coordinated. data collection implementation at the field level, IOM will require a Administrative Assistant to assist in all logistical and financial, recordkeeping and HR-related formalities.
Under direct supervision of the DTM Programme Manager, the Administrative Assistant will be responsible for the following:
Responsibilities and Accountabilities :

Provide administrative and logistical support to the DTM programme and fill out the required finance and procurement documents to support DTM field operations.
Keep a record and organize all finance and procurement documents submitted, as well as any other documents supporting DTM project implementation (i.e. project reports, correspondence with / from national authorities, note for files, etc.).
Monitor expenditure rates and report back on a weekly basis progress of burn and expenditure rates to the Programme Manager
Monitor existing resources such as DTM stationery stock and phone credit; estimate new requirements aiming at efficiency, cost-effectiveness and timeliness of operations and services for the DTM staff.
Provide HR assistance for the operations of the DTM unit by collecting CVs, shortlisting of the candidates and conducting interviews when field volunteers are requested and required to cover DTM operations in the field.
Provide HR assistance in the recruitment of third-party staff for the DTM unit.
Follow up with DTM staff in the timely delivery of staff attendance sheets for further forwarding to HR.
Follow up with HR on the timely pay to all third-party staff.
Follow up with field teams and finance unit on the preparation and liquidation of petty cash/cash advance according to IOM procedures and in a timely manner.
Assist to compile weekly and monthly reports for the units petty cash/cash advance in a timely manner and with accuracy.
Assist the unit in the organization of trainings in particular ensuring all the logistics are covered, booking of conference facilities, booking of refreshments and all the materials needed for the trainings.
Distribute office materials to DTM staff members as needed and maintain proper records;
Perform other duties as may be assigned by the supervisor.

Required Qualifications and Experience :
EDUCATION:

University or Bachelor’s degree in International Relations, Business Administration, Information Management, Social Science, Migration studies, Demographics and population studies, or a related field from an accredited academic institution with three years of relevant professional experience.
School diploma with five years of relevant professional experience .

EXPERIENCE :

Prior experience in logistical and admin-related processes to support deployment of enumerators for field data collection.
Experience of administrative, procurement and finance-related processes, preferably for a UN agency.

SKILLS :
Ability to coordinate with third-part contractors and other external agencies for the rapid deployment of staff.
Languages :
REQUIRED:
Good command of English and Fluency in Urdu is required (oral and written).
DESIRABLE :
Ability to speak in other regional langauges (e.g. Pashto, Balochi, Punjabi, Sindhi, Farsi) is an advantage.
Only short-listed candidates who is matching required criteria for the position will be contacted by IOM.
IOM provides equal opportunity to all qualified female and male including the physically challenged candidates.

At TCP Software, the network administrator is responsible for maintaining all physical, virtual, and cloud networks that keep our organization and systems running and optimized. From maintaining network security to supervising network updates and sharing and coaching IT helpdesk peers, the network administrator is not only IT support but also the thread that connects all operations. Deep technological expertise with a wide range of LAN/WLAN/WAN/MAN, computer and server systems, peripheral hardware, and software is essential for the network administrator to excel in this role and help drive our organization forward.
 Objectives of this Role

Manage all network design/optimizations, migrations, upgrades, implementations, and maintenance.
Provide network support across the organization.
Ensure network stability and resilience and maintain stable and consistent connectivity across all networks.
Prepare, implement, and test disaster recovery procedures.

As an Network Administrator, you will:

Manage all internal network infrastructure requirements; including switches, routers, firewalls, wireless access points, wireless controllers, structured cabling, phones, security cameras, physical access controls, and internet service providers.
Manage physical and virtual server administration & all associated tasks (ex: VPNs, security permissions, Users & group policies, network Integrations, 2MFA).
Assist in all physical and virtual server upgrades, patches, and vulnerability management.
Assist in Azure cloud infrastructure footprint management, expansion, and integration.
Research event-log warnings and errors; monitor resources to ensure that systems architecture components work together seamlessly.
Consistently monitor & troubleshoot performance, stability & health of Cloud, data-center Infrastructure & ISPs, using existing management tools and responding to hardware issues as they arise; help build, assess, and maintain new servers when needed.
Coach, Mentor, and provide Tier 2 level support to Jr. peers, troubleshoot & identify root causes.
Perform routine checks and scheduled audits of all systems, including configuration backups.
Recommend, evaluate, and implement system and security upgrades.
Create, adjust, and maintain network user settings and permissions.
Create & assist in the network system’s technical memory writing, standard operations procedures, manuals & IT Policies.
Act as an IT liaison to corporate and local offices, communicate network issues with peers, users, and management, leading troubleshooting issues & outages, ensuring security through access controls, backups, and firewalls.
Enforce and proactively correct all current structured cabling deficiencies, and design network architecture to easy expansions that are consistent with the standards and best practices.

You are a strong fit for this role if you have:

BS in Computer Science, Electronics, or other related field experience with 5 years minimum of experience with cisco CLI and enterprise network equipment.
Virtual and Cloud networking concepts and computing infrastructures.
Experience as a network engineer or network operations center agent with a high emphasis on performance and root cause analysis and monitoring tools.
Effective communication skills for training and assisting users.

Preferred Qualifications:

Desire certification: Cisco CCNA or CCNP or CCNE, CompTIA+/Security+/Network+.

Benefits:

Competitive salary
PTO and Sick leaves
In-Patient Health insurance
Provident fund and EOBI
The work/life set up you need to be successful.
A creative, collaborative, supportive environment that gives you the autonomy to explore new ideas, grow your skill set and create outstanding results
The chance to make a genuine impact on the company’s growth
Plenty of challenging work and the opportunity to stretch yourself

Job description for a Business AnalystAnalyzing and interpreting data: The business analyst is responsible for collecting and analyzing data to provide insights into business performance. This includes monitoring and analyzing metrics related to sales, marketing, customer service, and other key performance indicators.
Developing reports and dashboards: The business analyst is responsible for creating and maintaining reports and dashboards that provide data-driven insights to stakeholders. This includes identifying key metrics and visualizing them in a way that is easily understandable to others.
Identifying trends and opportunities: The business analyst is responsible for identifying trends and opportunities in the data. This includes identifying areas where the business can improve performance, as well as identifying potential new opportunities for growth.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams: The business analyst works closely with other teams, including sales, marketing, customer service, and product development, to understand business needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Communicating insights: The business analyst is responsible for communicating insights and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. This includes presenting data and insights in meetings, as well as preparing reports and presentations.
Maintaining data integrity: The business analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of data used in the analysis. This includes working with IT and other teams to ensure data is properly collected, stored, and maintained.
Staying up-to-date on industry trends: The business analyst is responsible for staying up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in data analysis. This includes attending conferences and workshops, as well as reading industry publications.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Data Science, or a related field

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Job Purpose:
 The International Water Management Institute (IWMI), a CGIAR Research Center, is looking for competent, self-motivated, and dynamic candidates to join as Intern on multiple projects. The IWMI Pakistan office is running various projects analyzing the implications of climate change on water and food security, energy, ecosystems, and marginalized urban and rural communities in Pakistan. The intern will support the project teams in the implementation of various research and administrative activities. Reporting to the project manager, the intern will assist in a wide range of tasks including but not limited to compiling literature reviews, data collection and analysis, and report writing, admin, finance and among other tasks.
 GENERAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist subject specialist in conducting literature reviews on the areas e.g. conducting literature review, compiling data sets, and data analysis. 
Assist the administration and finance specialist in administration duties and financial reporting. 
Assist the technical team in organizing events e.g. seminars, workshops and training. 
Assist with the development of research tools, including interview guides and survey questionnaires. 
Participate in IWMI’s various policy and science knowledge forums, workshops, and meetings and take detailed notes of proceedings. 


Perform any other duties within the scope of the project, as required. 

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED

Excellent interpersonal skills and teamwork. 
Good problem-solving skills. 
Good command of Windows Operating System Environment. 
Good IT skills particularly in Outlook, Word, Excel. 
Good spoken, written, comprehension of English. 
Good spoken, written, comprehension of Urdu. 
Ability and willingness to travel to other cities across Pakistan. 

MINIMUM EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED

For Administration and Finance Inten: Master’s degree in Business Administration 
For GIS & Remote Sensing: Master’s degree in GIS and Remote Sensing 
For Water Resources Engineering and Management: Master’s degree in any of Hydrology, Agricultural, Water Resources, Electrical and Civil Engineering 
For Monitoring &Evaluation and Economics: Master’s degree in any branch of Economics (Development Economics, Data Analytics, Agricultural Economics) 

Duration of the Assignment:
 The interns will be hired for the above tasks for a 1 year at the IWMI Pakistan office based in Lahore, with some travel to other cities or project sites as required.

About Us:
 

   CureMD excels in providing advanced tools and technologies that empower healthcare professionals to make informed decisions about patient care. Our state-of-the-art solutions harness the power of data analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to analyze patient information, decipher patterns, and render actionable insights. These advanced technologies equip physicians with profound insights into each patient's health, enabling them to formulate precise diagnoses, implement highly effective treatment strategies, and deliver top-quality care with ease.
 


   Job Overview:
 

   As a Level 1 SOC Analyst, your mission will be to safeguard our organization's information systems, focusing on compliance with healthcare regulations. Your role encompasses implementing advanced security measures, managing incidents, and ensuring the security of our cloud infrastructure. You'll monitor for threats, uphold data integrity, and maintain compliance with healthcare standards. This position demands a deep understanding of security protocols, cloud technologies, and regulatory requirements in healthcare, aiming to protect sensitive health data effectively.
 


   Essential Job Responsibilities:
 

 Implement and Monitor security alerts and events from Security Tools like SIEM, EDR, XDR, (preferably Azure Cloud Defender).
 Provide initial analysis and response to security incidents, including phishing attempts, malware infections, and network breaches.
 Engage in endpoint security monitoring, including the management of core Windows processes, event logs, Sysmon, and endpoint detection tools.
 Collect, analyze, and correlate security data from tools like EDR, SIEM for incident investigation and response.
 Assist senior analysts with incident response activities, including containment, eradication, and recovery.
 Document all activities, including incident tracking and report writing, to ensure accurate and timely information dissemination.
 Stay up-to-date on emerging threats and security trends through continuous learning.
 Review critical assets logs periodically to achieve security compliance.



   Required Qualifications:
 

 Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, Software Engineering or in Cyber Security.
 0-1 years of experience in IT Security.
 Understanding of Cloud-based IT infrastructure.
 Good reporting, documentation and presentation skills.
 Knowledge of basic IT security concepts.



   Preferred Qualifications:
 

 Knowledge of Incident Management Processes.
 Hands-on experience with tools like MS Azure Cloud Defender, Manage Engine, or Cloudflare.
 Knowledge of SIEM solutions, EDR, or XDR.
 Certifications such as CEH, CC or CompTIA Security+.



   Compensation and Benefits:
 

 Competitive base salary and yearly bonus.
 Health benefits (Outpatient, Inpatient, Maternity).
 Provident Fund company matches up to 8% of the base salary.
 Company-sponsored trainings, workshops, education, and development programs.
 Collaborative yet fun-loving atmosphere: space that fosters employee wellbeing.
 Commuter support, supportive workspaces, gym facility, and daycare.

Job Title: Data Scientist (Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Sciences)

Developed tailored statistical algorithms for various analytical tasks, including monthly network performance analysis, smart asset movement optimization, predictive site outage detection, and root cause analysis.
Utilize data-driven insights to forecast energy targets for all power sources, optimizing power source utilization and enhancing overall site performance.
Process data from multiple APIs using Python, including solar irradiance, weather conditions, and temperature data. Ensure the development of clean and modular code for efficient data processing and integration into the AxIn platform.
Demonstrate proficiency in Python programming and libraries like NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and Keras.ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and data manipulation tasks
Strong understanding and hands-on experience with Apache Airflow, Spark, and other data processing frameworks.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and data visualization tools like Apache Superset is a plus.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams (backend, frontend, product) to translate business needs into technical solutions.

   Job Overview:
 


   As Database Administrator (DBA) you would ensure databases run smoothly 24/7, focusing on high availability and quality tailored to user roles, building and designing databases according to needs, defining user access, ensuring data security, and maintaining database performance.
 


   Essential Job Responsibilities:
 



     Database Maintenance: Oversee and maintain databases across various SQL Server versions (2008/2008 R2/2012/2014/2016/2017).
   


     Handle and resolve database-related issues efficiently.
   


     Monitor system parameters to optimize database performance.
   


     Assess and plan for data growth and system capacity needs.
   


     Work collaboratively with development teams to identify and resolve performance issues and to suggest improvements.
   


     Develop and recommend tools for effective database and server resource monitoring.
   



   Required Qualifications:
 



     Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a closely related field, or equivalent practical experience.
   


     Entry-level to 2 years of experience in database management, with a focus on MS SQL Server.
   


     Ability to deliver effective and precise solutions for customer queries and issues.
   


     Healthcare IT Experience: Experience in managing databases within the IT Healthcare sector is a plus.
   


     Hands-on experience with SQL Server tools like SSIS, BIDS, and performance monitoring utilities.
   


     O/A levels or equivalent international educational experience.
   


     Experience with RDBMS administration e.g., MSSQL
   


     Excellent knowledge of MSSQL and database management systems
   


     Good knowledge of physical database design
   


     Basic Understanding of database performance tuning.
   


     Strong problem troubleshooting and database monitoring skills.
   


     Strong query writing skills
   


     Good knowledge of MSSQL backups and recovery methods
   


     Excellent analytical skills and ability to work independently.
   


     Knowledge or experience in database migrations.
   


     Strong communication and interpersonal abilities.

     Competitive base salary and yearly bonus.
   


     Health benefits (Outpatient, Inpatient, Maternity).

    2 WeeksBackground



Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‘leave no one behind’ approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and inspiring stories.



UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

UNDP is the leading United Nations organization, fighting to end the injustice of poverty, inequality, and climate change. Working with our broad network of experts and partners in 170 countries, we help nations to build integrated, lasting solutions for people and planet.
 The Agenda 2030, based on a set of 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), is underpinned by a strong commitment to leave no one behind and to reach the furthest behind first. It recognizes the multi-dimensional nature of poverty and inequality and provides a framework that comprehensively addresses all dimensions of well-being. Pakistan was one of the first countries in the world to endorse the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) at the Sustainable Development Summit held on 25 September 2015. In 2016, Pakistan Parliament unanimously approved the SDGs as the national development agenda. Since then, Pakistan has demonstrated an impressive policy, institutional, and financial commitment to achieving SDGs, embracing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, and leaving no one behind by adopting the UNDP-supported Goals frameworks as part of its national development planning. Since adopting the Sustainable Development Goals as the National Development Agenda, the Punjab Government took the lead in establishing the SDGs Support Unit at the Planning & Development Board in collaboration with the United Nations Development Programme.
 As a second-generation intervention of the long-standing National Initiative for SDGs (2016-2023), the Punjab SDGs Plus Project, as a joint initiative of UNDP Pakistan and the Government of Punjab, is launched to strengthen a policy integration approach, evidence-based decision-making, resilient institutional capacities, diversified partnerships, mobilization of innovative financing, and integrating climate resilience, innovation, social protection and inclusion to provide a comprehensive ‘SDG Push’ in priority policy areas to help Punjab embark on a stable, sustainable, and accelerated trajectory of achieving the SDGs. The project is anchored by an integrated framework comprising three key areas based on the provincial priorities, including:

Objective 1: Internalizing SDGs: Improved governance for SDGs aligned equitable and inclusive development planning, budgeting, expenditure tracking, monitoring, and reporting, with a special focus on underdeveloped/marginalized districts to achieve regional equalization.
Objective 2: Financing for Development and Climate Resilience: Public and private financing for development, identifying and channeling resources to reduce the development financing gap, focusing on SDG investments and climate financing.
Objective 3: Inclusive Development, Social Protection, and Innovation: Gender equality, inclusion, innovation, and digital transformation mainstreamed in SDGs to achieve Leave No One Behind.

Under the supervision of the Project Manager, SDGs Plus Project in Punjab, the Financing for Development Specialist’s prime responsibility is to ensure the following deliverables:
 The Financing for Development Specialist works under the direct supervision of the Project Manager and guidance from the Assistant Resident Representative, Development Policy Unit UNDP and collaborates closely with the UNDP Pakistan DPU colleagues, Punjab Planning & Development Board and the relevant stakeholders at the provincial and district levels.


 Duties and Responsibilities:

Development of Financing Policy Framework

Create synergies with the private sector around financing for development portfolio including creating avenues for identifying and/or co-financing SDG-linked projects, involvement in public-private partnerships, sponsorships, support with advocacy and community engagement.
Provide technical support to design and implement a comprehensive Provincial Financing for Development Framework.
Facilitate the rollout and adoption of the framework across provincial and regional levels whilst ensuring linkages across provinces and federal initiatives.
Conduct in-depth policy analysis and research on international best practices in Financing for Development to inform the design of the national framework.
Curate and implement innovative financing programme portfolios for SDGs Investments, Development and Climate Financing, and Climate Resilience.
Develop plans (particularly resource planning) around disaster resilience and environmental sustainability under the broader ambit of Climate Financing, leveraging investment solutions, with a focus on flood/disaster resilience.
Assist in leveraging UNDP’s SDGs Investment and Climate Change Facility aimed at advising the Government on an integrated institutional policy framework for Development Financing.
Provide technical assistance and capacity-building support to both public and private sectors in developing and implementing projects, defining Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and creating policy frameworks.
Identify potential funding sources and financing mechanisms to diversify the funding base for SDGs-aligned projects.

Managing and Harnessing Strategic Partnerships and Forums

Set up and manage Strategic Partnership Forums to foster collaboration with development partners and facilitate mobilization of private-sector financing for SDGs through a mix of instruments, including blended finance models, and the scaling up of private-sector partnerships.
Leverage these partnerships to support institutional processes and tap into local and regional financing opportunities for developing pipelines for bankable projects, strengthen environmental laws and policies, and build implementation capacities to develop disaster resilience and preparedness.
Develop a sustainability plan for strategic partnerships, ensuring continuous engagement, commitment, and alignment with SDGs financing goals.

Knowledge Management and Dissemination

Develop policy briefs and conduct policy dialogues on the success stories, best practices, challenges, and opportunities in SDG financing, resource mobilization, and tapping the role of especially the private sector in closing financing gaps.
Keep abreast of regional and global trends and issues on Financing for Development and Climate Resilience, analyze their implications, and incorporate recommendations collected from the public and private sector stakeholders.

The incumbent performs other duties within their functional profile as deemed necessary for the efficient functioning of the Office and the Organization.


 Competencies:


Core competencies:

Achieve Results: LEVEL 3: Set and align challenging, achievable objectives for multiple projects, have lasting impact.
Think Innovatively: LEVEL 3: Proactively mitigate potential risks, develop new ideas to solve complex problems.
Learn Continuously: LEVEL 3: Create and act on opportunities to expand horizons, diversify experiences
Adapt with Agility: LEVEL 3: Proactively initiate and champion change, manage multiple competing demands.
Act with Determination: LEVEL 3: Think beyond immediate task/barriers and take action to achieve greater results.
Engage and Partner: LEVEL 3: Political savvy, navigate complex landscape, champion inter-agency collaboration.
Enable Diversity and Inclusion: LEVEL 3: Appreciate benefits of diverse workforce and champion inclusivity.

Cross-functional & Technical competencies
Digital & Innovation

Alternative finance: Ability to identify potential alternative forms of finance and mobilize them to address development challenges; Ability to review the skills, capacities, procedures, and protocols that are needed to enable new financial mechanisms; Ability to assess the risks, limitations, and implications of using new financial mechanisms.

Partnership management

Resource mobilization: Ability to identify, develop, and manage partnerships that leverage private sector technical expertise and resources.

Information Management & Technology

Data Management & Analytics: Knowledge in data management, data sciences, ability to structure data, develop dashboard and visualization. Design data warehouses, data lakes or data platforms concepts. Familiarity with Machine leaning natural language processing or generation and the use of artificial intelligence to support predictive analytics. CDMP or TOGAF9 or equivalent certification desirable.

Finance

Development Finance Expertise: Ability to develop and work with innovative financing mechanisms and instruments, e.g. social/development impact bonds, guarantees, climate finance, etc.

Partnership Management

Relationship Management: Ability to engage with a wide range of public and private partners, build, sustain, and/or strengthen working relations, trust, and mutual understanding.

Business Direction and Strategy
System Thinking: Ability to use objective problem analysis and judgement to understand how interrelated elements coexist within an overall process or system, and to consider how altering one element can impact on other parts of the system.


Required Skills and Experience:



  Education: 
 


Advanced university degree (master's degree or equivalent) in Economics, Public Policy, Finance, Business Administration, Public Administration, or related disciplines is required. Or
A first-level university degree (bachelor’s degree) in the above listed fields of study with an additional two years of qualifying experience will be given due consideration in lieu of the advanced university degree.



  Experience: 
 


Minimum 5 years (with master’s degree) or 7 years (with bachelor’s degree) experience around financing for development including policy research, engagement with the private sector and public-private partnerships.
Experience in the use of computers, office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc.), and web-based management systems, and advanced knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages.
Proven practical skills and familiarity with policy development, data management and analysis, economic forecasting, and gauging middle and macro-level impact and needs assessments.
Experience in and ability to communicate and function effectively with diverse stakeholders in national, international, and multicultural environments.
Organizational knowledge and experience including strategic planning, decision-making self-management, emotional intelligence, conflict management, delivery, communication, and negotiating skills.
Demonstrated experience in working and engaging with the private sector including the finance sector with an ability to identify, develop, and manage partnerships that leverage private sector technical expertise and resources.
Experience of innovative financing mechanisms and instruments, e.g. social/development impact bonds, guarantees, climate finance innovation, and public-private partnerships in Punjab.
Proven track record in offering policy guidance and strategic technical assistance in the realm of Financing for Development, particularly within a multi-lateral context.
Experience in working, liaising, and collaborating with governments, NGOs, civil society organizations, and public international organizations.

Required Languages:

English and Urdu
Knowledge of other local languages is an asset

 iENGINEERING is currently seeking an ideal candidate who will assume the responsibility of leveraging AI pipelines to manipulate data across diverse projects. This individual will play a key role in identifying and addressing any issues within the pipeline, while also maintaining performance analytics to guarantee optimal functionality.
   

 Requirements
 What you’ll be doing: 

 Utilize AI pipelines to manipulate and process data for different projects according to project requirements. 
 Monitor and maintain the performance of AI pipelines, ensuring smooth operation and timely delivery of results. 
 Develop and maintain documentation related to AI pipeline workflows, configurations, and troubleshooting procedures. 
 Conduct performance analytics to evaluate the effectiveness of AI pipelines and identify areas for optimization. 
 Conduct performance analytics and build dashboards for team performance focusing on manual effort vs automation effort. 
 Provide technical guidance and support to team members regarding the use and maintenance of AI pipelines. 
 Ensure adherence to data security and compliance standards in all AI pipeline activities. 
 Emphasize strong communication and collaboration skills for effective cross-functional teamwork. 
 Showcase project management skills, demonstrating the ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines. 
 Emphasize a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on advancements in AI and data analytics. 


 What you’ll bring along:



 Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field with 1 - 2 years’ experience of working with data products. 
 Good understanding of programming languages commonly used in data manipulation and analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL. 
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues. 
 Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model deployment processes. 
 Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality results. 
 Experience in maintaining performance analytics and generating insights from data. 
 Experience with geospatial data analytics and ESRI products. 
 Understanding of Transportation Infrastructure Ecosystem and Asset Management. 
 Troubleshoot issues within the AI pipelines, including data quality problems, algorithmic errors, and performance bottlenecks. 
 Relevant certifications in AI, data analytics, or related fields are a plus.


 Benefits

 A dynamic and collaborative work environment 
 Opportunities to work on best-in-class technology solutions

 An empowering culture with high degree of freedom

 Duties and Responsibilities:

Development of Financing Policy Framework

Create synergies with the private sector around financing for development portfolio including creating avenues for identifying and/or co-financing SDG-linked projects, involvement in public-private partnerships, sponsorships, support with advocacy and community engagement.
Provide technical support to design and implement a comprehensive Provincial Financing for Development Framework.
Facilitate the rollout and adoption of the framework across provincial and regional levels whilst ensuring linkages across provinces and federal initiatives.
Conduct in-depth policy analysis and research on international best practices in Financing for Development to inform the design of the national framework.
Curate and implement innovative financing programme portfolios for SDGs Investments, Development and Climate Financing, and Climate Resilience.
Develop plans (particularly resource planning) around disaster resilience and environmental sustainability under the broader ambit of Climate Financing, leveraging investment solutions, with a focus on flood/disaster resilience.
Assist in leveraging UNDP’s SDGs Investment and Climate Change Facility aimed at advising the Government on an integrated institutional policy framework for Development Financing.
Provide technical assistance and capacity-building support to both public and private sectors in developing and implementing projects, defining Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and creating policy frameworks.
Identify potential funding sources and financing mechanisms to diversify the funding base for SDGs-aligned projects.

Managing and Harnessing Strategic Partnerships and Forums

Set up and manage Strategic Partnership Forums to foster collaboration with development partners and facilitate mobilization of private-sector financing for SDGs through a mix of instruments, including blended finance models, and the scaling up of private-sector partnerships.
Leverage these partnerships to support institutional processes and tap into local and regional financing opportunities for developing pipelines for bankable projects, strengthen environmental laws and policies, and build implementation capacities to develop disaster resilience and preparedness.
Develop a sustainability plan for strategic partnerships, ensuring continuous engagement, commitment, and alignment with SDGs financing goals.

Knowledge Management and Dissemination

Develop policy briefs and conduct policy dialogues on the success stories, best practices, challenges, and opportunities in SDG financing, resource mobilization, and tapping the role of especially the private sector in closing financing gaps.
Keep abreast of regional and global trends and issues on Financing for Development and Climate Resilience, analyze their implications, and incorporate recommendations collected from the public and private sector stakeholders.

The incumbent performs other duties within their functional profile as deemed necessary for the efficient functioning of the Office and the Organization.


 Competencies:


Core competencies:

Achieve Results: LEVEL 3: Set and align challenging, achievable objectives for multiple projects, have lasting impact.
Think Innovatively: LEVEL 3: Proactively mitigate potential risks, develop new ideas to solve complex problems.
Learn Continuously: LEVEL 3: Create and act on opportunities to expand horizons, diversify experiences
Adapt with Agility: LEVEL 3: Proactively initiate and champion change, manage multiple competing demands.
Act with Determination: LEVEL 3: Think beyond immediate task/barriers and take action to achieve greater results.
Engage and Partner: LEVEL 3: Political savvy, navigate complex landscape, champion inter-agency collaboration.
Enable Diversity and Inclusion: LEVEL 3: Appreciate benefits of diverse workforce and champion inclusivity.

Cross-functional & Technical competencies
Digital & Innovation

Alternative finance: Ability to identify potential alternative forms of finance and mobilize them to address development challenges; Ability to review the skills, capacities, procedures, and protocols that are needed to enable new financial mechanisms; Ability to assess the risks, limitations, and implications of using new financial mechanisms.

Partnership management

Resource mobilization: Ability to identify, develop, and manage partnerships that leverage private sector technical expertise and resources.

Information Management & Technology

Data Management & Analytics: Knowledge in data management, data sciences, ability to structure data, develop dashboard and visualization. Design data warehouses, data lakes or data platforms concepts. Familiarity with Machine leaning natural language processing or generation and the use of artificial intelligence to support predictive analytics. CDMP or TOGAF9 or equivalent certification desirable.

Finance

Development Finance Expertise: Ability to develop and work with innovative financing mechanisms and instruments, e.g. social/development impact bonds, guarantees, climate finance, etc.

Partnership Management

Relationship Management: Ability to engage with a wide range of public and private partners, build, sustain, and/or strengthen working relations, trust, and mutual understanding.

Business Direction and Strategy
System Thinking: Ability to use objective problem analysis and judgement to understand how interrelated elements coexist within an overall process or system, and to consider how altering one element can impact on other parts of the system.


Required Skills and Experience:



  Education: 
 


Advanced university degree (master's degree or equivalent) in Economics, Public Policy, Finance, Business Administration, Public Administration, or related disciplines is required. Or
A first-level university degree (bachelor’s degree) in the above listed fields of study with an additional two years of qualifying experience will be given due consideration in lieu of the advanced university degree.



  Experience: 
 


Minimum 5 years (with master’s degree) or 7 years (with bachelor’s degree) experience around financing for development including policy research, engagement with the private sector and public-private partnerships.
Experience in the use of computers, office software packages (MS Word, Excel, etc.), and web-based management systems, and advanced knowledge of spreadsheet and database packages.
Proven practical skills and familiarity with policy development, data management and analysis, economic forecasting, and gauging middle and macro-level impact and needs assessments.
Experience in and ability to communicate and function effectively with diverse stakeholders in national, international, and multicultural environments.
Organizational knowledge and experience including strategic planning, decision-making self-management, emotional intelligence, conflict management, delivery, communication, and negotiating skills.
Demonstrated experience in working and engaging with the private sector including the finance sector with an ability to identify, develop, and manage partnerships that leverage private sector technical expertise and resources.
Experience of innovative financing mechanisms and instruments, e.g. social/development impact bonds, guarantees, climate finance innovation, and public-private partnerships in Punjab.
Proven track record in offering policy guidance and strategic technical assistance in the realm of Financing for Development, particularly within a multi-lateral context.
Experience in working, liaising, and collaborating with governments, NGOs, civil society organizations, and public international organizations.

Required Languages:

English and Urdu
Knowledge of other local languages is an asset

Job Description

What we’re looking for:

 iENGINEERING is currently seeking an ideal candidate who will assume the responsibility of leveraging AI pipelines to manipulate data across diverse projects. This individual will play a key role in identifying and addressing any issues within the pipeline, while also maintaining performance analytics to guarantee optimal functionality.
   

 Requirements
 What you’ll be doing: 

 Utilize AI pipelines to manipulate and process data for different projects according to project requirements. 
 Monitor and maintain the performance of AI pipelines, ensuring smooth operation and timely delivery of results. 
 Develop and maintain documentation related to AI pipeline workflows, configurations, and troubleshooting procedures. 
 Conduct performance analytics to evaluate the effectiveness of AI pipelines and identify areas for optimization. 
 Conduct performance analytics and build dashboards for team performance focusing on manual effort vs automation effort. 
 Provide technical guidance and support to team members regarding the use and maintenance of AI pipelines. 
 Ensure adherence to data security and compliance standards in all AI pipeline activities. 
 Emphasize strong communication and collaboration skills for effective cross-functional teamwork. 
 Showcase project management skills, demonstrating the ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines. 
 Emphasize a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on advancements in AI and data analytics. 


 What you’ll bring along:



 Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field with 1 - 2 years’ experience of working with data products. 
 Good understanding of programming languages commonly used in data manipulation and analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL. 
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues. 
 Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model deployment processes. 
 Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality results. 
 Experience in maintaining performance analytics and generating insights from data. 
 Experience with geospatial data analytics and ESRI products. 
 Understanding of Transportation Infrastructure Ecosystem and Asset Management. 
 Troubleshoot issues within the AI pipelines, including data quality problems, algorithmic errors, and performance bottlenecks. 
 Relevant certifications in AI, data analytics, or related fields are a plus.


 Benefits
 What we offer:


 A dynamic and collaborative work environment 
 Opportunities to work on best-in-class technology solutions 
 Competitive salary and benefits package 
 Centrally located office in Blue Area, Islamabad 
 20 days of annual/sick leaves plus gazetted holidays 
 An empowering culture with high degree of freedom

Description :
 Note: Through proactive pipelining, we are collecting profiles for upcoming future roles and you will be only contacted if your profile is shortlisted for this role which may not be currently open.
 Grade Level: L2
What is a Data Scientist?
 The role reports directly to the Data Science Practice Lead. You will be part of a 9 member passionate team of Data Scientists
 What does a Data Scientist do?
 We, as a team, are involved with all commercial stakeholders to deliver value to our customers by identifying hidden patterns, predicting subscriber activity, or developing affinities within our customer base. This is an opportunity for you to become part of the biggest data science team in the telecom industry of Pakistan and learn from the best of the industry experts in the field.
 Jazz is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate, support, and thrive on diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

 Requirements
 What are we looking for and what does it require to be a Data Scientist?
 We are looking for someone with at least 3 years of (flexible based on the candidate’s potential and prior experience) strong data science background. Work experience in the telecom sector would be a plus. The candidate must have the following:
 Knowledge of data analysis, statistical modelling, and data mining required
 Expertise in predictive modelling techniques using Python language (R is a plus)
 Candidate should be able to perform segmentation (Behavioral, usage, lifetime etc.) of subscribers
 Candidate will work on product recommendation engines helping to determine the next best offers to be launched mostly through BTL medium.
 Candidate will be required to be an enthusiastic and thoughtful communicator and collaborator with the tech and non-tech teams alike. The ability to explain, clarify, and synthesize complex projects and concepts for a wide-ranging audience is critical, both in verbal and written format.
 Experience with Teradata and Data Warehousing concepts is a plus
 Experience with Data Visualization and communication through data visualization tools like matplotlib, ggplot, d3.js. or Tableau
Benefits
 Why Join Jazz?
As one of the leading employers in the country, Jazz epitomizes the philosophy that each Jazz employee is passionately living a better every day inspired and enabled by visionary leadership, a unique professional culture, a flourishing lifestyle, and continuous learning and development.
 Our core values include qualities essential for a positive organizational culture - truthfully guiding entrepreneurial and innovative mindsets, harnessing professional and interpersonal collaboration, and fostering across-the-board customer-obsession.
 As one of the largest private sector organizations in Pakistan, our objective is to continue to change the lives of our 75 million customers for the better. This is an opportunity for someone who wants to be part of something transformative, someone who can play a critical role in driving our success. Together, we can empower millions more with the tools necessary to progress in an increasingly digital economy.

ABOUT INTERNSHIP


 Job Title: Intern (Supply Chain)
Type of contract: Internship
Number of Openings: 2
Unit: Supply Chain
Duration: 6 Months
Duty Station: Islamabad
Vacancy Number: 831670
Date of Publication: 4th March, 2024
Deadline of Application: 15th March, 2024
This internship opportunity is for Pakistani Nationals only.




 TERMS AND CONDITIONS



Interns receive a monthly stipend from WFP
WFP is not responsible for living expenses, arrangements for accommodation and related costs.
WFP will recognize candidates’ educational credentials from recognised institutions that have been certified by Higher Education Commission.





JOB PURPOSE


 The WFP Pakistan Supply Chain Internship Program offers a unique opportunity for young professionals to gain practical experience and contribute to addressing food security challenges in Pakistan and Afghanistan. This program aims to develop a diverse talent pool and enhance skills in warehouse management, supply chain optimization, and sustainable initiatives. Through hands-on responsibilities such as systems mapping, warehouse consolidation studies, site development exploration, funding identification, and inventory management optimization, interns will actively contribute to improving operational efficiency and emergency response. Join us to gain valuable experience and make a meaningful impact on food security and sustainability initiatives in the region.




 KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES (not all-inclusive)



Develop a comprehensive systems map for the WFP Pakistan warehouse system, covering Karachi, Peshawar, and Quetta. Consider the estimated volume flow and optimize space utilization within WFP Pakistan's warehouses. Identify areas for improvement to enhance efficiency under the lead of Head of Supply Chain/ Supply Chain Officer.
Conduct a study on the potential consolidation of warehouses. Evaluate feasibility, benefits, and challenges, and provide recommendations for each consolidation.
Collaborate with the Pakistan Head of Supply Chain and Logistics Staff to explore the development of different optimisation strategies to enhance cost efficiencies.
Support Supply Chain Officer in developing a emergency preparedness plans.
Work with relevant headquarters units, Regional Bureau and Logistics Cluster to identify funding opportunities for sustainable and environmentally friendly initiatives. Assist in preparing grant applications to secure additional funding.
Examine the best warehouse practices implementation across all Pakistan WFP warehouses. Ensure effective application of the first-in, first-out (FIFO) principle. Utilize WFP's corporate Palantir system to assess and improve stock monitoring, forecasting, and replenishment procedures.


 




DELIVERABLES



Comprehensive systems map for the WFP Pakistan-Afghanistan staging warehouse system, including Karachi, Peshawar, and Quetta. The map should optimize space utilization, consider volume flow, and highlight areas for improvement.
Study report on the potential consolidation of warehouses in Peshawar and Karachi, outlining feasibility, benefits, challenges, and recommendations for each consolidation.
Proposal for developing the Quetta site, exploring the transition from a Mobile Storage Unit field warehouse to a fully compliant enclosed fixed structure warehouse. The proposal should include assessing requirements, costs, benefits, and potential challenges.
Identify funding opportunities for sustainable initiatives and assistance in preparing grant applications. Documentation of funding sources and potential collaborations.
Evaluation report on implementing best warehouse practices across WFP warehouses in Pakistan. Recommendations for improving inventory management, including inventory accuracy, stock-out reduction, and optimization of inventory levels.





STANDARD MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS


 Education:
Undergraduate, Bachelor's degree (within six months prior to the application to the internship programme) from a recognized university and have attended classes in the last 12 months of enrolment in the university in Social Sciences, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Mathematics, Statistics or any other relevant field.
Education: Previous experience in Freight Forwarding, Shipping is an advantage
Knowledge & Skills:

Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point)
Proven experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
Familiarity with data visualization tools and techniques. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Language:
Fluency in English Required




 HOW TO APPLY


 To be considered, interested candidates are invited to apply via (https://www.wfp.org/careers/job-openings). Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
WFP will not request payment at any stage of the recruitment process including at the offer stage. Any requests for payment should be refused and reported to local law enforcement authorities for appropriate action.
Request for Disability related Reasonable Accommodations:
It is important to WFP to create an accessible and inclusive workplace for everyone. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the selection and hiring process, please direct your request and inquiries to the Diversity and Inclusion team on: global.inclusion@wfp.org, cc’ing pakistan.hr@wfp.org. A member of the reasonable accommodation team will contact you to
confidentially discuss your needs.
This email is only to be used for any disability related accessibility requirements, and not for sending the application itself. Due to volume of applications, any applications or CVs sent through this email address will not be considered as a formal application and will not receive a reply from WFP.

 ABOUT WFP


 The World Food Programme (WFP) is the leading humanitarian organization saving lives and changing lives, delivering food assistance in emergencies and working with communities to improve nutrition and build resilience.




 ORGANIZATIONAL CONTEXT


 These internships will be based in Country Office Islamabad, Pakistan and the interns will report directly to Supply Chain Officer or the designate.




 .


 Qualified female applicants are especially encouraged to apply
WFP is committed to diversity and inclusion within its workforce. WFP has zero tolerance for sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, abuse of authority or discrimination. All selected candidates will, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

You will be participating in exciting projects covering the end-to-end data lifecycle – from raw data integrations with primary and third-party systems, through advanced data modeling, to state-of-the-art data visualization and development of innovative data products.
You will have the opportunity to learn how to build and work with both batch and real-time data processing pipelines. You will work in a modern cloud-based data warehousing environment alongside a team of diverse, intense, and interesting co-workers. You will liaise with other departments – such as product & tech, the core business verticals, trust & safety, finance, and others – to enable them to be successful.
Your responsibilities

Design, implement and support data warehousing;
 Raw data integrations with primary and third-party systems
 Data warehouse modeling for operational & application data layers
 Development in Amazon Redshift cluster
 SQL development as part of agile team workflow
 ETL design and implementation in Matillion ETL
 Real-time data pipelines and applications using serverless and managed AWS services such as Lambda, Kinesis, API Gateway, etc.
 Design and implementation of data products enabling data-driven features or business solutions
 Building data dashboards and advanced visualizations in Sisense for data cloud teams (formerly Periscope Data) with a focus on UX, simplicity, and usability
 Working with other departments on data products – i.e. product & technology, marketing & growth, finance, core business, advertising, and others
 Being part and contributing towards a strong team culture and ambition to be on the cutting edge of big data
 Evaluate and improve data quality by implementing test cases, alerts, and data quality safeguards
 Living the team values: Simpler. Better. Faster.

Sabre is a technology company that powers the global travel industry. By leveraging next-generation technology, we create global technology solutions that take on the biggest opportunities and solve the most complex challenges in travel.
 


   Positioned at the center of the travel, we shape the future by offering innovative advancements that pave the way for a more connected and seamless ecosystem as we power mobile apps, online travel sites, airline and hotel reservation networks, travel agent terminals, and scores of other solutions.
 


   Simply put, we connect people with moments that matter.
 


   Team Description
  
 Sabre Corporation is a leading technology provider to the global travel and tourism industry. Headquartered in Southlake, Texas, USA. we serve customers in more than 160 countries around the world. At Sabre, we make travel happen. Positioned at the center of the business of travel, our platform connects people with experiences that matter in their lives. Today, we’re creating a new marketplace for personalized travel. It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs for our airline, hotel, and travel agency customers. Join our journey!
  
 Sabre’s Legal Department is a dynamic group responsible for providing legal advice to and assisting the Company in conducting business ethically and in compliance with laws around the world. Sabre is seeking a skilled and motivated licensed attorney to join our legal team in India as a Principal, Legal. The successful applicant should be a generalist with deep knowledge of Pakistan law and will be responsible for providing legal advice to the organization on general corporate and commercial law, employment, regulatory, immigration law, litigation, data privacy, intellectual property, trade secrets, and other areas specific to the technology industry. The position will report to Sabre’s SVP - Deputy Chief Legal Officer. This role will provide ancillary support to the Compliance & Ethics function in the region, as well as employment matters in the region.
  
 Role and Responsibilities
  
 What will you achieve?
 

 Perform manual testing of browser, mobile, API, and embedded applications with minimal supervision.
 Write, review and execution of test scenarios with test automation tools (preferably selenium).
 Troubleshoot issues in software.
 Document and maintain test cases.
 Provide analysis of testing results to our development team for needed improvements and further development.
 Automate everything that we’d repeatedly, often using heterogeneous tools.
 Using the test framework to achieve “zero defect” target.
 Work with Product Owners and external teams to continuously raise the quality bar of our products
 Enable developers to use the test framework to test their code before check-in.


 What's in it for you?
 

 Working with a state-of-the-art hotel property management system. The sky is the limit when it comes to what you can do.
 Opportunity to do something that has high impact and game changing in our industry
 Be part of one of the world’s largest Travel and Hospitality technology company


 Must Have Skills
 

 Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or related field.
 1-2 years of manual testing experience.
 Be familiar with agile development and scrum concepts.
 Experience with JIRA
 Estimate, plan, execute and manage the testing efforts for our products.
 Write, review and execution of test scenarios both manually and with test automation tools.
 Develop, review and maintain artifacts produced during the STLC.
 Work on end-to-end SDLC, agile testing methodologies and test phases including unit, integration, system, regression and performance testing.
 Create detailed test cases and test scripts.
 Translate the requirements or user stories into test scripts.
 Communicate effectively with development teams to get the issues resolved and addressed.
 Hans on experience on UI testing.
 Basic SQL knowledge


 Nice To Have Skills
 

 1-2 years of hands-on software testing experience (Web & App).
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering
 Solid hands-on experience with framework development and ability to achieve end-to-end automation of workflows (optional).



   We will give careful consideration to your application and review your details against the position criteria. You will receive separate notification as your application progresses.
 


   Please note that only candidates who meet the minimum criteria for the role will proceed in the selection process.
